case.name: SZBVM v Minister for Immigration and Citizenship [2007] FCA 332 (19 March 2007)

citphrases.citphrase: application for review of decision of refugee review tribunal affirming decision not to grant protection visa
applicant a citizen of the ghana claiming a well-founded fear of persecution on the basis of his membership of a social group
no obligation on the tribunal to produce evidence rebutting an applicant's claim
no general obligation on the tribunal to exercise its power under migration act 1958 (cth) s.427
application for review of decision of refugee review tribunal affirming decision not to grant protection visa
applicant a citizen of the people's republic of china claiming fear of persecution as a falun gong practitioner
no obligation on the tribunal to make its own investigations of the applicant's claims
the relevance of independent country information and the weight given to it are matters for the tribunal
application for review of rrt decision affirming decision of a delegate of the minister not to grant a protection visa
applicant is a citizen of the people's republic of china claiming fear of persecution because his parents had been arrested as falun gong supporters
no obligation on the refugee review tribunal to conduct its own inquiries
application for review of rrt decision affirming decision of a delegate of the minister not to grant a protection visa
applicants are citizen of indonesia claiming fear of persecution
where applicant did not attend the tribunal hearing
application for review of decision of refugee review tribunal affirming decision not to grant protection visa
citizen of fiji claiming fear of persecution by way of domestic violence
application for review of rrt decision affirming decision of a delegate not to grant a protection visa
applicant is a citizen of bangladesh claiming fear of persecution for reasons of his religion, political opinion and social group
application for review of decision of the rrt affirming a decision of a delegate of the minister not to grant the applicant a protection visa
applicant a citizen of bangladesh claiming fear or persecution for reason of political opinion

citances.sentence: Indeed that matter was recently considered on appeal from this Court in SZBVM v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 332 at [16] .

Whilst the Refugee Review Tribunal has the power to seek information in any way or to require further information or even investigations to be taken, it is well established that there is in general no obligation upon the Tribunal to do so (see SZBVM v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 332 at [16] and SZIRO v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 260 at [12] ).
There are no circumstances shown that would generate any obligation on the Tribunal to make any further investigations (see SZBVM v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 332 at [16] ).
(See SZBVM v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 332 at [16] ).

I think it is well established in a number of decisions, including SZIRO v Minister of Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 260 at [11] and SZBVM v Minister of Immigration& Citizenship [2007] FCA 332 at [16] , but whilst the Tribunal has power to seek further evidence it does not have an obligation to do so.
There is no general obligation on the Tribunal to make further inquiries (see SZBVM v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 332).

In SZBVM v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 332 , Tamberlin J said at [16]:
The third ground of the appeal relates to an asserted duty of the Tribunal to make enquiries under s.427.
Again in relation to s.427 Tamberlin J had this to say in SZBVM v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2007] FCA 332 , again a decision on appeal from this Court.
